Subjects: de la Pole, William, duke of Suffolk
_description: Against the Earl of Suffolk, A.D. 1448 — a seven-line tag

BLHar543.Transcription: But Suthfolke Salisbery and Saybe don to deathe by mayeengland may synge wellawey
BLHar543.Note:
Three-lines monorhyming followed by prose, “whill suthfolke was shorete and put in irens the kynge went to a parliament at lescester…” Preserved on a page of John Piggot’s memoranda, c. 1450.
                    ‘set on the gate of powles writen to this effecte’.
